alert.note: Alert for Pierce; Rolette (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 17 at 12:58PM CST until February 17 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 3 AM to 6 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning commute. Strong winds could cause some damage to roofs, small outbuildings, and signs. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family member of your travel plans. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
